paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: The paper discusses various mutations in the TTR gene associated with hereditary transthyretin amyloidosis, focusing on the V30M mutation and several other non-V30M mutations.

patients.phenotype: ATTR amyloidosis, primarily cardiac and neuropathic symptoms

individual_records.evidence_sentence: A total of 97% with type A and none of the patients with type B fibrils displayed 99mTc-DPD uptake at scintigraphy.
The V30M mutation (n = 48) dominated, but seven other non-V30M mutations were found.

functional_data.summary: The V30M mutation is associated with a high degree of amyloid fibril formation.

variants.segregation_data: Segregates with disease in families, particularly in those with early-onset symptoms.
variants.evidence_level: Moderate evidence based on clinical presentation and family segregation.
variants.additional_notes: The study primarily focused on the V30M mutation, with additional non-V30M mutations mentioned.
key_quotes: The V30M mutation (n = 48) dominated, but seven other non-V30M mutations were found.
None of the patients with type B fibrils displayed uptake of 99mTc-DPD at scintigraphy.

individual_records.evidence_sentence: The Y114C mutation was noted in patients carrying the Y114C mutation.

functional_data.summary: The Y114C mutation is associated with amyloid fibril formation.

variants.evidence_level: Moderate evidence based on clinical presentation.
variants.additional_notes: The Y114C mutation is rare and associated with specific phenotypes.
key_quotes: Type B fibrils have thus far only been found in predominantly early-onset V30M and in patients carrying the Y114C mutation.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data was extracted from the main text and tables.
